conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container it will flow into.
Starting from point A, the liquid flows downwards and hits the first baffle.
The liquid from point A then flows to the right and hits the second baffle.
After hitting the second baffle, the liquid from point A flows downwards and hits the third baffle.
The liquid from point A flows to the right and enters container E.
Starting from point B, the liquid flows downwards and hits the first baffle.
The liquid from point B then flows to the right and hits the second baffle.
After hitting the second baffle, the liquid from point B flows downwards and hits the third baffle.
The liquid from point B flows to the right and enters container F.
Starting from point C, the liquid flows downwards and hits the first baffle.
The liquid from point C then flows to the right and hits the second baffle.
After hitting the second baffle, the liquid from point C flows downwards and hits the third baffle.
The liquid from point C flows to the right and enters container E.
Starting from point D, the liquid flows downwards and hits the first baffle.
The liquid from point D then flows to the right and hits the second baffle.
After hitting the second baffle, the liquid from point D flows downwards and hits the third baffle.
The liquid from point D flows to the right and enters container F.
Liquid from points A and C will flow into container E, while liquid from points B and D will flow into container F.
